definition: free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: We stood in silence watching the fish glide effortlessly.
sentences.chinese: 我们静静地站着，看着鱼儿逍遥自在地游来游去。

sentences.english: And althoughpoliceareconstrained by national borders, criminals roam freely.
sentences.chinese: 警察限于国境之内，罪犯却能逍遥自在四处漫游。

sentences.english: They jaunt about quite a lot,especially during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常逍遥自在地四处游览，特别是在夏天。

sentences.english: She is an easygoing, frank and open-minded girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个逍遥自在的，坦白的和虚心的少女。

sentences.english: Mr. Tapley appeared to be taking his ease on the landing of the first floor.
sentences.chinese: 塔普利先生想必正逍遥自在地在二楼的楼梯口歇着呢。

definition: to have no cares/to be carefree
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
to go on a scenic tour
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
